Reviews.Title: “Nice smaller hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at Park8 Hotel Sydney located in the heart of the shopping district. Close to the park, Oxford Street, the rocks, darling harbor and shopping. We had a two story room which was very cool as it felt like a loft like apartment with kitchen. Very clean and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in an ideally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiffyW_11
Reviews.Content: We returned today from our Easter stay at Park8 Sydney travelling with two other couples. The hotel is in an ideal location for shopping, dining and enjoying Sydney's nightlife. The close proximity to Town Hall train station made it a good base for exploring further a field.The reception is nicely appointed with an oil burner, flowers, current magazines and always a smiling helpful staff member. A small cafe/bar is next to the reception where we enjoyed a light breakfast and excellent coffee with a view of the street. The rooms were very clean, modern and comfortable. My only small annoyance was frequent siren noise throughout the night and a lack of lighting in the room with the room containing mostly small lamps but not enough overhead lighting. Overall though all the couples we travelled with thought the hotel was very good and would be happy to rebook next year (which we probably will).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to everything oh and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: J_RBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 and had a wonderful time. The staff were lovely and so helpful from the time we arrived to when we left. The room was cosy and just what we were after and we only paid $155 because I did some research and booked very early. The air con and the bed were great and made our stay very comfy. If I ever come to Sydney I will definitely be staying here again Thank you for such a relaxing stay

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: esbs
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Sydney and chose this hotel mainly because the website stated that there was carparking available. It would have been helpful to know that the hotel does not have its own facility, but instead directs you to the hotel next door (at $75 per day). Further complicating the problem, there is nowhere to park on Castlereagh St while you check in. The receptionist did not have any other parking suggestions, so we were left to stand in the foyer and google solutions ourselves. We ended up leaving the car in an underground mulit-level across the park ($35 per day), which was a 15 minute walk away. My lift key didn't work and needed to be re-coded. The room was in need of an update- the carpet was lifting and worn in areas of joins, and there were several light globes which needed replacing (the receptionist tried to replace a couple of them, but didn't have the correct globe). The bed, however, was wonderfully comfortable, with nice linen. It was fairly noisy, but I that's to be expected of the CBD. We had breakfast included, and it was pretty good! Room service only, from the little takeaway cafe downstairs. Breakfast wraps and toasties, and good DiBella coffee. The location was excellent for access to buses and for attractions. While overall we weren't unhappy with our stay, we probably won't stay here again. We usually drive when we come to Sydney, and the parking issue was a real sticking point for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night in the City”
Reviews.Author: Mikaila D
Reviews.Content: We live close to Sydney and decided to treat ourselves to a room for a night out instead of having to deal with taxis and transport! We weren't disappointed with our choice. We stayed in a loft room which was lovely. It had a large spa-shaped bath and the size of the whole apartment was impressive. The bed was comfortable however the pillows were not. The pillows were very thin and there was no selection of pillows. The only problem was our air conditioner. It made a lot of noise every time to compressor kicked in (about every 10 minutes!). Between the air conditioner and the pillows we unfortunately didn't get a very good nights sleep. The staff were incredibly friendly (even smiling when we requested more towels at 3am!). The location is fantastic. A short walk from everywhere we wanted we to go. We would stay here again, after checking that the air conditioning is working quietly!

Reviews.Title: “Shocked !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honestythebestpolicy
Reviews.Content: Well I hope that Mercedes will post this review. I want to address a few issues I faced when I decided to give Park8 a try. My friend and I travel to Sydney regularly and we decided to change from our normal hotel so I found Park 8 on the internet and was happy with what I saw. I rang the hotel four times and was reassured that the rooms were of an excellent standard. When we arrived I was shocked at how dusty and dirty the hotel was and how much the rooms needed renovating. Cracked paint and mould in the bathrooms, a strong smell of old alcohol and smoke from downstairs ... Oh yes this boutique hotel sits above a pub. When I inform the staff (Hugo and Mercedes ) that I wouldn't be staying there ... Hugo disappeared and then Mercedes took over( and from the conversation) I felt she had done this before ... I asked for a refund and finally was reassured that I would get a full refund of my money so as to did accommodation in a more suitable hotel . I have jut discovered they have kept a nights ccommodation from my account and I am saddened as She reassured me that they were sobbusy they would fill the room immediately. We asked them to hold the room until 4 pm as it was 3:15pm and she informed us that she would but inwe didn't contact her by then they would give to other customers .We were able to secure the HIlton hotel for $199 which was cheaper than Park8 we were paying $255 for a run down dusty hotel for a 5star luxury room at the Hilton. So Mercedes I would appreciate the return of my money as what you say your hotel is on the Internet is very misleading .

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: Chatterbox2012
Reviews.Content: Let me say it was great to see such a beautiful smiling face on arrival at your hotel. And the smiling still followed through even from the Manager at 4am return. I've been in the indusrty for over 20 yrs and have travelled alot, so it was very reassuring to see that our hospitality workers are doing their bit in keeping Austrailian tourism alive. After all we all want to feel like we are home when travelling, what better way then a friendly smile and a chat.. Also the location and room where spot on.. (but we can get that anywhere) Top marks for such pleasant staff...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Imqaretman
Reviews.Content: At around $200, you could do a lot worse than Park8 for a bed for the night. Very friendly reception staff. Clean room. A bit noisy outside but it is low rise in the CBD. For the money, I couldn't complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great value hotel...super comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Bazza76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park 8 during the super busy and super expensive Mardi Gras weekend. The room was booked a few months in advance for $145/night which is a great rate for that weekend. On walking through the front door you're struck by the very small size of the reception area - there really are no facilities at the hotel - just the in house coffee shop - it's all about the rooms. The room and bathroom were both very large and nicely decorated. The bed was fantastic - very, very comfortable. Our 4th floor room overlooked the busy Park St but I didn't find noise an issue at all. There was a bar fridge in the room and if asked I believe the hotel will stock it with minibar items. We bought some beers then realised there was no bottle opener provided - so bring your own! It would be nice for the hotel to include even a cheap, throwaway one in the event guests decide to take it home! The hotel can also order in from local eateries and deliver to the room which is a nice service. There is plenty going on around the hotel...it's very close to the Westfield Sydney shopping centre, takeaway food options and a couple of gyms - the hotel gives out complimentary passes to the Fitness First Park Street. Special mention to the front desk staff who were really expectional throughout - very willing to help out with info on local amenities and just generally helpful & fun! Would definitely look to stay at the Park 8 next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmcbeath
Reviews.Content: My family and I recent stayed at the Park8 Hotel on Castlereagh Street. I cannot rave enough about the location. Just a few metres up the road is the Westfield Shopping Plaza which comes out at Pitt Street Mall. We stayed in a standard room and unfortunately I think we had the worst room in the hotel (Room 508). Tucked away in the corner of the hotel this room was small, dark and needs renovating to bring it back up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. Other family members stayed in standard rooms on alternate floors and had beautiful rooms which I would have expected from this hotel. Overall, the staff were friendly and helpful. A great little coffee shop located in the foyer of the hotel for coffee lovers. I did have an issue where I was charged a different room rate upon check-out from what I had confirmed, however this was sorted once brought to their attention. I would recommend this hotel, however make sure you dont stay in 'Room 508'!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel, the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Yeshwant N
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Australia and chose to stay at the Park8 primarily because of its location near Hyde Park. The rooms were pretty darn good. I was traveling with a friend so we got a two twin room. The rooms were good sized, the bathroom was pretty big and overall it was extremely comfortable. Noise was never a problem, but it never is for me. The check-in was smooth. The manager and staff were very customer friendly. The coffee shop in the lobby whips up delicious Mocha's (no need to go to the starbucks across the street). The location of the hotel is awesome. Close to all the major sites in Sydney. I enjoyed my stay so much, I have booked it again for the overnight stay before I go home. The only complaint....well the lift moves real slow :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: CnD0523
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I read good things about this hotel when we searched for a hotel in Sydney, After our stay, we agree with the reviews. This boutique hotel is very good. The hotel location is excellent. It is close to the train stations. The city tourist attractions are all within walking distance. Also there are plenty of cafes, restaurants, pubs, grocery stores and fast food chains close by. And the Westfield shopping mall is nearby if you fancy a bit of shopping. The Room is very comfortable. The hotel upgraded our room as we stayed for 5 days. The room is clean, spacious and has all the amenities. And there is free WiFi in our room. The Staff is very friendly and helpful. It is our 1st time in Sydney, and the staff is more than happy to help us with finding our way in the city. During checkout the lift was broken, the staff without a complain carried our 30kg luggage down the stairs. Truly impressed with the service. We really enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP
Reviews.Content: Situated on Castlereigh st, Park8 hotel is close to nearly everything you're going to want to check out as a visitor to Sydney. Not only were we within walking distance to QVB (Queen victoria building), but the botanical gardens, China town and Circular Quay were all within reach and hyde park was just on our door step. Free wifi, free newspapaers, great breakfasts and friendly staff really make park8 a standout choice for us. Our room was a corner room which was both roomy and comfy. All this at a room rate which is far better value than most other big name hotesl, We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kelliebean27
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Park8 Hotel in February 2011 as a bit of a break before returning home after a cruise. We booked online at a special discount since they had recently opened and were trying to get their name out. This really is a fabulous basic hotel. We were in no way disappointed! Our room was big and airy, plus we were fortunate enough to have a view of the Chinese New Year parade from our window which was a brilliant surprise. The beds were cozy and even though the streets are busy we barely heard a sound at night. The amenities are basic, TV and Foxel are great. The location is perfect for walking distance to all trains, the monorail and trams. Walking to Pitt St was very easy. The big Woolworths on the corner of Park St and George St really had everything we needed, including an internet kiosk on the upper level. I would reccomend this hotel to couples or groups of friends, perfect for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Excited to stay!”
Reviews.Author: stephr007
Reviews.Content: Park8- I just booked in for a couple of nights in late feb for myself, my husband and my in-laws, before my husband and I head back to the states. I booked here specifically b/c you actually respond to user reviews and support TripAdvisor. Can already tell we'll have a great experience! See you in a few weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Small but great in every other way”
Reviews.Author: Snoops172689
Reviews.Content: We booked in here over the Christmas period for a bit of a treat. The staff were excellent, friendly and very helpful. The room was small and a bit dark but spotlessly clean well furnished. The breakfast and room service was spot on, very well priced and convenient. Great location for people wanting to explore central parts of Sydney's CBD!

Reviews.Title: “awesome value”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: We too stayed here when it was called something different - and to use an aussie expression i think they had tickets on themselves - i dont remember being impressed. Sydney is an amazing city & to get a room of this standard in the school holidays for $155 with free wi fi and - wait for it - not a bl***y 10.00am checkout or even 11.00 but 12.00 was just fantastic. Add to this the friendly staff, the great value coffee shop in reception offering low priced room service breakfast items and u are on a winner. Bed was a bit soft but it was so big it didnt matter. Booked thru hotel web site & saved the wotif booking fee :) hope there are still good deals on Park8 on our next visit - if u love Thai - Sailors Thai in the Rocks

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel right in the heart of Sydney with excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Emz1976
Reviews.Content: Top customer service and personal attention. Nicely decorated rooms which were clean and well-appointed, not huge but very comfortable. Excellent room service menu, breakfast well priced and delicious. Great location right near everything the Sydney cbd has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and modern boutique in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Worldlywisdom
Reviews.Content: Has a small entrance facing Castlereagh St. Inside is a little modern lobby and coffee bar, and of course the very friendly staff. They're slightly flexible with check-in times and try to assist when possible. The standard double room was spacious, very modern with a distinct style and at least 4 star standard. Everything was clean and everything worked. The only gripe is that the lights were too dim, especially with the dark decor. So don't plan to read too much. On the other hand the curtains and windows are great at blocking out noise - despite being near a busy intersection. There's a handy sink and fridge in the room too (see photo). The bathroom was a little crowded, and there was a shower only, but a bit larger than a standard cubicle. Location is perfect, as others have said. It's right next to Hyde Park, and all attractions can be reached in about 20-25 minutes' walk (Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Opera House). Alternatively, Town Hall station is 5 minutes away. Lots of shops, restaurants, and a couple of shopping centres are also a few minutes away. The price was standard - about 120 AUD/night midweek. There were certainly no disappointments and would be happy here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: Travel12370
Reviews.Content: The location is great to explore the CBD with many attractions (Hyde Park, Darling Harbor, Power Plant Museum and more) within 20 minutes walk or less. We had a split level room with the kids sleeping all three at the big bed upstairs and the two of us turned the sofa into a bed for the night. Despite what we read in some reviews, our room (403) was very quite. In the morning you can either go out for breakfast at the many places around or get some fresh bread rolls and have it at your room. The hotel provides a great coffee bar. The friendly lady at the reception kindly handed us three free internet codes for all the gadgets and informed us that we can use the gym around the corner. Although I didn't use the gym I'm pretty sure that this is a better arrangement as going to the usual small gyms you find in (too) many hotels. For 385 excl. breakfast this seems good value given its location and the room size / set-up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service, arguably best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jojewjew
Reviews.Content: After issues with our booking in an affilate hotel we were transferred to Park 8. We were on a road trip and anyone who has driven through Sydney understands how shocking it is. As we were already delayed for a tour this drive across town set us further back. Thankfully the receptionist from Park 8 rang us to advise us of the built up traffic around the area and told us to go straight to the carpark. This was greatly appreciated and they even covered the cost of parking to make up for the other Hotel's mix up, saving us $140. The rooms were tidy, the view quite nice and the hospitality priceless. A lovely girl by the name of Alex served us the next day with a fantastic coffee and a friendly smile also providing us good advise to take the scenic walking route to Circular Quay. Despite our difficulties with Sydney the staff at Park 8 really made our time in the city so much more enjoyable. Would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Adina_Michael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location and it has the best staff we have come across in ages!! We had a business meeting on York street, which was withing walking distance and at night we had dinner at Pendolino, one of the restaurants they recommend. It was also very close by and it was excellent, plus it was just across the road from the theatre, where we went to see to wonderful Jersey Boys! We had room 405 and it was spacious, very nicely decorated, had enough light during the day and we could open the window for fresh air. We did find the lighting a bit poor at night, but if we put the bedside lamp on the bed head, rather than the bed side table, we found that it was actually very good for reading. Bed was king size and very comfortable, with nice linen too. The bathroom was big, with a great rain shower and very nice toiletries. Fridge and A/C did not make any noise at all. Sure, the street was noisy, but as someone else said before, you are in the middle of the city, not in a quiet suburb/the country. We did not find it disturbing though. We heard a siren going past once every evening as we were getting ready for bed, but we have no idea of what happened once we were asleep. Because I have read the reviews I came prepared with ear plugs, but my husband did not have any and he did not have any problem. It might be that higher rooms get less noise, so maybe ask for a higher floor or a room not facing the street if you are concerned. But don't let this stop you from choosing this hotel. It really is very nice, it is in the middle of everything and it has wonderful staff. Thank you so much to Andrea, Hugo and Pierre for all the help, great coffee and nice smiles :) You all rock!

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: maxie88
Reviews.Content: I don't think this hotel does itself any favours by describing itself on the website as a 'five star' ' oasis of space and tranquility'. This creates expectations that are not matched by the reality. The location is excellent for Sydney's entertainments and shopping, but it is on a busy intersection and although the traffic noise was tolerable there were emergency vehicles with sirens blaring at regular intervals all night, plus raucous revellers shouting and screaming in the street below. This could be managed by double-glazing the windows overlooking Park Street and Castlereagh Street, but the windows are only single-glazed and quite inadequate for this situation. We had a Deluxe Room number 304. The rooms are adequate. Probably furnished to a four star standard, although there was only an office chair and a small footstool and the desk was small. The style is minimalistic, which in this case just looked sparse and a bit worn in places. The bed and bedlinen were good. The website promised down pillows but the ones in the room were polyester fill. The staff were very apologetic and provided two down pillows after a couple of hours. The second room we booked for relatives didn't have down pillows either so I doubt that these are provided as standard. The bathroom was adequate as well, but somewhat short of luxurious and not overly spacious. Surprisingly, the fridge in the room was noisy and I had to turn it off at the wall - a problem I've only had in budget motels in recent years! The aircon control made a strange crunching noise every time it kicked in, so I turned the aircon off as well. After one sleepless night we'd had enough and decided to move. Many thanks to Andrea on Reception for being so helpful and sympathetic. Although we'd booked two rooms for two nights she indicated that she'd get authorisation to refund the second night back to us, whereas the hotel would be within its rights to charge for both nights. Much appreciated. I echo the comments of others that the hotel staff are exceptional, and make up for some of the shortcomings. In summary, and reading the reviews of others, I believe that if I had obtained a rate of about $165 a night I would have expected more of a budget hotel and been satisfied. I paid $260 a night and felt ripped off as a result. We have now moved up the road to the Sheraton (which really does have the facilities of a five star hotel) for a rate of $230 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Poorly lit”
Reviews.Author: Mark255115
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park8 Castlereagh St on a recent Friday and Saturday night. I was in a 3rd floor room on the Castlereagh frontage. Noise from the street on both nights was atrocious, with constant emergency service sirens and screaming intoxicated people through to the early hours (4am) each night. Room and amenities good, staff very pleasant but lighting in the room was so dull that I had to use my mobile phone torchlight to read my book in bed! Black and brown dÃ©cor didn't assist, but a bedside light with a 40w bulb behind a dark lampshade meant no light at all once in bed. Will be looking for other accommodation next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Traveltilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in mid-November while on vacation. I selected this hotel based on the location (in the CBD), price ($165/nt which was very hard to find in the CBD) and the reviews (which were pretty good). I had a few concerns going in, but was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a VERY good location. It is in the heart of things with shops restaurants, the park, public transportation, a taxi stand, etc right around it and about a 10-15 minute walk to Circular Quay. Also, the CBD free shuttle stops near it which was convenient if we didn't want to walk. The room was plenty spacious and nice for us (the rooms were a little dark with the curtains closed). There wasn't a bath tub (just a standing shower) which was fine by us but might not be ideal for someone else. In addition to the location, the other big plus was the front desk staff. They were super friendly and willing to help with reservations, recommendations, etc. - anything we may have needed help with. The one negative was the cleaning service. The first two days they made the bed and that was about it - no new towels, no wiping down the counters, etc. After I said something to the front desk, that improved. The other potential negative was street noise. When we were in the room, we could hear traffic, but it never woke us up. We are also from NYC, so have a certain tolerance for that. Overall, I was very pleased and happy we chose the Park8 Hotel for our stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Travelexpeditions
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and modern, has a boutique style. The room was nicely made in an average size. Bed is queensize but comfortable and WiFi is for free. The only 2 things we didn't like were: Our window was painted with a white painting so you couldn't see outside, neither could you open it. The other thing is the pretty expensive breakfast. But just go to pie face (30m) or any other place. Location is very good, walking distance to a lot of things like darlingharbour, victoria building, shopping centres (the fine food court is excellent)...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly and safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby T
Reviews.Content: Hi, My friend and I stayed here last week as we were attending a yr 12 formal as teachers in the city.The minute we walked in there was a sense of serenity with the black interior, dim lighting and soothing music playing. Such a contrast to the busy Castlereagh street. The man on the desk was immediately attentive and before we know it we were on our way to our room. The room was very lovely and big, the bed was huge and the bathroom was massive. The rain shower was an absolute delight. When we came back from the formal at 1.30am we rang to organise a wake up call and Alex was nothing but friendly and accommodating to our requests. We have more events that we will be attending in the city and we hope we can book here again soon. Thanks again to everyone at Park8 and keep up the fantastic service. Lucy

Reviews.Title: “Bad mark, good mark...”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Just a quick note on an experience I had at Park8. When I got in, I started to iron a business shirt for the next day. The iron started to mark the shirt, and I couldn't get the mark out. A staff member came straight up and replaced the iron, although the damage was done. When I got home I tried to launder the shirt and get the mark out, but to no avail. I approached the hotel about this, and with out hesitation they worked to remedy the situation. What I thought was going to be a difficult situation was actually quite easy. The bad mark gave them a good mark. Now that is service after the fact.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kerry553
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have to have the best location if you want to be near the shops and CBD in Sydney. Sure it is a bit noisy at night - but you are in the centre of the city... not a country retreat. We had the two bedroom suite and it had heaps of room. TV in both rooms and also downstairs in the living room. The staff is what made the difference, they were SO helpful and friendly... nothing was a problem. They all could make fantastic coffee and our kids hotchocolate every night. We were only there for 4 nights but they treated us as if we were their most important visitors ... but they do that to everyone. I would never stay in a large hotel in Sydney again. Stay here you shouldn't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: oz_flashpackers
Reviews.Content: Nice, updated room. Linen was fine. Street noise was not too much of a problem - though you are in a city hotel! Close to services. Woolworths 2 blocks away. Late night takeaway all near by. Numerous hotels nearby for drinks and food. 20 min walk to Circular Quay. Staff were friendly and good for advice on what is nearby, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but very good memories”
Reviews.Author: barry b
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and found the hotel really clean, the staff wonderful in attitude and always very helpful. My wife is now in a wheel chair and the hotel bent over backwards to make us feel welcome and accomodated our needs always with a smile. We would love to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seal_76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Sydney and it was excellent. Friendly staff, rooms was perfect and it is so central it's not funny. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Llyw
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when in Sydney it's reasonably priced, great location for tourist attractions and travel links, and very well decorated inside. On the last visit, for three nights, we unfortunately had to be moved each night due to a problem in the bathrooms. It's a testament to the very high customer service we received that this review is a positive one - always friendly, always available to help with booking taxis, checking ferry times, recommending restaurants, lending umbrellas, nothing was too much trouble. By the final night they upgraded us gratis to a penthouse suite, but the deluxe room (bathroom aside) was very comfortable - big bed, decent size TV, plenty of storage space. Will definitely use again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and well-located.”
Reviews.Author: Malleeboyz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room (deluxe) was fine, with excellent bathroom and a very comfortable king-size bed. Warm, friendly and helpful reception staff. Park8 is close to Hyde Park and handy to airport rail link.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never”
Reviews.Author: OztravelsAust
Reviews.Content: Wow this review is late! But we just had a very average experience with accommodation in Boracay so as 'Kama' I thought I best revisit the 'other side'. We stayed at Park8 in June after a three month assignment on a very isolated island in Vanuatu. We were also meeting our daughter and her new boyfriend who we also booked into the hotel. As you can imagine we were really looking for some luxury and something more appealing than canned tuna and rice. The staff at Park8 were amazing. Incredibly accommodating, nothing was to much trouble. The rooms although smallish were well laid out, modern and comfortable. In terms of position you couldn't ask for much better. We would happily recommend Park8 to anyone! Sorry staff I can't remember your names after so long....but you know who you are : )

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, recently redeveloped”
Reviews.Author: ryancropp
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it had a great rate over the weekend for the Sydney CBD and we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel has a small street frontage on Castlereagh St and the views out the window are nothing to write home about, but the rooms are absolutely fantastic. Our room was recently redeveloped and had a flat panel TV, ipod dock, great comfortable queen size bed as well as a huge bathroom. The staff are fun and helpful and the coffee was top notch in the mini espresso bar downstairs. However, leave the car at home. There's no parking on site and the hotel parking is $60 per day at the Hilton on Pitt St. The access to public transport is unparalleled, with the hotel two blocks or less from Town Hall and St James stations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, centrally located, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazza7712
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the third floor facing castlereagh street. The room wasn't large but it was adequate and unlike some of the other reviewers our room was externally facing and there wasn't any noticeable traffic noise. You can tell the rooms have been recently re-vamped although I think the quality of the make over is a bit superficial and the rooms could soon start to look worn/tired. Both the bedside lamps in our room were broken but when we informed reception they fixed them very quickly (just a couple of blown bulbs). As mentioned in previous reviews, the facilities do just extend as far as a small reception desk and coffee bar. That said, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the pastries from the coffee bar were very good for a fast breakfast. The location is superb for tourism - only a short walk (10-15 min) from opera house/harbour bridge and right by the shops and restaurants of the CBD. In summary, very good value if you get a room like ours

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Cindy188
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights and enjoyed the prime locationâ€”close to everything. Our room was great. It was on a corner with lots of window views of the city and a huge bathroom. Sleek and contemporary decor; liked the charming B & W photos on all the walls of hotel. Staff was greatâ€”so friendly and helpful from the guy on the phone helping us with our arrangements from the U.S. to the staff behind the desk. Also liked that they had a place in the tiny, intimate hotel lobby to buy coffee and bagels, etc., in the morning. Price was right for what you getâ€”this is a small downtown hotel that tries very hard, and succeeded with us. Internet was freeâ€”a real plus. We'd stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: dodge5
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights / 2 days in Sydney and stayed here. Location was excellent for everything, right in the Central Business District and only a 15 minute walk to the Harbour. Rooms and accomodation were excellent and the staff very very friendly and helpfull. Everything that would need is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and good service but ...”
Reviews.Author: jogoony
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write because there are so many positives about this hotel. Yet, the hotel itself has not provided me with a satisfactory stay that makes me want to go back. I will start with the Positives: The hotel is located in the best part of town. It's right in the middle of the "action" on Castlereagh Street. This means that if you are a business traveller, it's a 10 - 15 mins walk to your meetings in the city centre or a very short cab ride away. And if you are a traveller, you are 2 - 3 mins away from the major shopping malls (including the brand new Westfield complex, David Jones, Myer and Queen Victoria Building), food and cafes. Don't let the initial look of the hotel location deter you. It does feel like you are on the "gritty end" of town at times (especially at night when the pub-crawlers are out and you have small children with you) but it's quite safe. The other positive is the very friendly staff members. Two lovely attendants Tia and Andrea made our stay exceptionally pleasant. They were helpful and caring, and one of them is a barista so she makes good coffee as well. It's a small boutique hotel with less than 50 rooms (from memory) so the service is very personalised. The rooms are a good size. There is no traffic noise once you are in the room even though Castlereagh St is considered a major street. There is also a pub downstairs but you don't hear the noise at night. The facilities provided include good storage, a mini-fridge (no contents so you can fill the fridge up from the Woolworths - ie large supermarket, down the road), iron, hairdryer, shampoo/conditioner, multiple channels on a new flatscreen TV (no movies though). There is a little coffee counter bar at reception for a quick toast/croissant, coffee or hot chocolate. The Negatives: the hotel has been recently renovated so it does has some funky additions like forest green carpet and designer lamps. However, one gets the feeling that it's a budget, cosmetic renovation. The hotel still feels (and sometimes, smell) old. We were allocated the 5th floor rooms. I had wanted 2 rooms as I had children travelling with me. The rooms were meant to be next to each other but with another common door that closes and locks so that we can leave the room doors open. However, that common door is non-existent as it has come off the hinge. We ended up with mum and dad with one child each. The 5th floor has very very low ceilings through the corridor and feels very claustrophobic. It felt like it might have been a roof space or attic prior to the renovation. One of the rooms allocated to us was an internal room, ie it has no natural light except through a small frosted glass window. The shower also leaked (this was fixed) and then the light bulb blew in the bathroom so the bathroom was very dim (not fixed). The other room had natural light but it would have been better if the window had been frosted as we got the view of unsightly city roof tops and the fire escape stairwell. The worse thing was that the strong cigarette smoke from the pub downstairs drifted upstairs into this room (through the closed windows) which made the air in the room quite unbearable. We managed to move to another room downstairs that night. So for the rest of the trip, we were on separate floors. The new room was better but again it was an internal room. The lights didn't work so the room was quite dark at night (the bedside lamps and desk lamp being the only lights, and these were quite weak). The lights were not fixed. The aircon was extremely loud and there were flying bugs in the room! To make things worse, my bedroom was not made the next day. On the very last night, all of the lights went out in my new room. The receptionist managed to find me another room across the hall. This new room was a dream. If only I had this room from the start! It had a window (no frosted glass!) to Castlereagh St below. It had working lights and quiet air-conditioning! If you want to book this hotel, I strongly suggest that you ask for the rooms that face Castlereagh Street and not the internal rooms. I also warn against staying on the 5th floor!! However, the family suites are on the 5th floor and these look nice. I felt bad for the staff who tried to fix my problems. I know that it's not their fault but it does feel like the hotel operates on a budget. They couldn't fix the lights and air-con and the rooms don't get cleaned if we miss the cleaners who come in during the day. However, I want to quickly point out that the negatives are all relative to the room rate. The rates are extremely reasonable for Sydney (at $175 per night per room) so I really have No real reason to whine about anything particularly because the staff was so nice. This review is just a heads up for those who expect a lot more than a basic, tourist-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTripTaker
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking to stay at Park 8. I chose it based on its proximity to shopping and affordability (in Sydney terms that is). I only stayed one night. The location was just a 5-10min walk to the heart Sydney Shopping Heaven but the other elements of the accommodation were fairly AVERAGE. I feel this place has real mixed reviews when flicking through them all, so I will try and just portray a few quick facts. The rooms are quite small (as in there isn't really room to walk around in them) but they do have gd storage, a tv, bedside lamps which are good for the bookworms, and my room even had an iron + ironing board. The rooms are quite dark unless you request for a window room, which I strongly recommend if you need to put on makeup -but I guess you are there to sleep & I experienced no noise problems, but if you are a light sleeper, ask for a higher floor, towards the middle of the building. I only engaged with one staff member and he didn't really come across as friendly to me at all, the guy couldn't even point a tourist in the direction of the Circular Quay...mmmm. When I first arrived & opened the door to my room I was surprised to find that house keeping had not been in & the old linen was on still covered on the bed...the room would have been good if it was clean as it had a gd study desk and natural light from the window but the bathroom also had a water leak under the sink so the floor was all wet. They offered to take my bags and clean the room in the next few hours, but said water problem could not be attended to in that time. I conveyed this was not really what I expected and they offered to upgrade my room for no extra charge, but the next room they gave also had a similar dripping problem in the bathroom, so i just asked for another room to the same standard as I had originally booked, to which was clean and plumbing problem free :) Then the stay picked up & I was a happy camper. Upon leaving they even offered to hold my bags for a short time so I didn't have to lug my bags all over town.I would give this place another shot but I would probably look around first but the location is pretty hard to beat, so if you need convenience and don't need luxury, then this place fits the brief. Let me know if you have any further questions at all & I hope this review helps you make a decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bchaplin852
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in january and loved it. The modern decor is great and staff are always helpfull. Also located in the middle of sydney above a pub but no noise to be herd. Great place will defently stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: t04st
Reviews.Content: Dirty bathroom - not even a doona cover - just in between two sheets????! Holes in the bathroom Wall. Rust, mould, taps not fixed in place? Perhaps better suited to hiring by the hour

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location, recently refurbed”
Reviews.Author: jaspas0
Reviews.Content: Can't get a better location, Staff were very friendly & helpful, room was comfortable, the only minus is the noise from the Fire Brigade & Ambulance going past, but you live with that in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussi_traveller_77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a Deluxe Room and found it very comfortable, nicely furnished and spacious. The rain shower was great. Hugo and the other staff couldn't have been any better with advice on where to eat and also how to get around the city, perfect! Thanks guys see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the 'Boutique' tag in boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: LukeandMarie
Reviews.Content: As I frequently stay in large corporate hotels for work, I often enjoy staying in smaller, 'boutique' establishments for pleasure, both in Australia and overseas. It is however a bit of a problem when so many places seem to flag themselves as 'boutique' to the extent where the term has become synonymous for 'small with no real service to speak of''. One such hotel, unfortunately is the Park8 in Sydney, which whilst it is indeed under some sort of renovation (little more than a cafe on the ground floor and smart black clothes for the concierge) it really does not fit the 'boutique' tag, which seems to extend only to the room rate. the room was tiny and very sparsely furnished (I have no issues with minimalism, but this was more spartan than minimalist - and the varnished tree log bedside table really did not make the room 'designer-like') the carpet remained the old green carpet that survived the renovations from the time the hotel was just the accommodation rooms above the old Windsor pub. The most dissapointing room however, was the bathroom, which by all account had not been renovated at all (I hope not in any case) but still retianed the charm of a public injecing room or public toilet. No problems at all with the service, however, because of the lack of any discerning facilities (mini bar; room service etc), service was merely confined to checking in and checking out. Overall, a very poor choice of 'boutique hotel' and far too expensive for what it was - service however, was the highlight: speedy and polite

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Discover55
Reviews.Content: Booked the 2 bedroom loft apartment. Comfortable enough but dark and not very modern. Cold water taps did not work in shower or bath - the only way to get clean was to run a (very) hot bath and wait an hour for it to cool down. Can see from a previous review that this has been a problem before that has not been properly addressed. Reception staff were very friendly and beds were comfortable. No sound proofing so lots of sirens during night. Booked at a last minute discount rate but would have been very upset if paying full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay in the park end of town”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPeteShow
Reviews.Content: This is a well appointed, trendy little place to stay. The staff are excellent - very willing to assist with anything asked of them, and always up for a chat when you come back after exploring. My 4th floor room had a comfortable king sized bed, and a TV cleverly suspended in the corner of the room, to save space. The air con/heater worked well, and it was nice to be able to open the windows a bit, to let in some 'fresh' air. It has the usual room facilities - including iron and ironing board. Before you contact reception asking for an ironing board, check behind the curtains. It may be lurking there. There are some rough patches in the plasterwork if you go looking for them - which gives you the idea that perhaps this place didn't always look this chic. But nothing intrusive. Wifi is available for $20 per day. Free access to the gym up the road is a bonus. Great location, with easy access to the train station. Much cheaper than a taxi to/from the airport. Worth considering if you get a good rate, and are looking for something up that end of town.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: CHARLIEBLM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a shopping weekend in May, myself and my husband, the location was great, centre to the shopping and train station etc. Staff were very friendly and always willing to help The hotel itself was very quiet, and room comfortable Ã­t was nice to have a sink bench in the room good value for money would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: la_psyche
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park8 for one night for a business trip, and it was just right for what I needed. The location was fantastic - I chose Park8 as it was the closest hotel within budget to where my meetings were, but it was also really close to the main shopping district. The room was lovely, the tv in just the right place to watch while sprawled on the very comfortable king size bed. Bathroom was big and I was a big fan of the massive shower head. Also really liked the tree stump nightstands and appreciated that there was an iron and ironing board in the room, as well as a desk. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place for a short stay. My only suggestion is in the room I was in that the wall behind the bar fridge should be plastered up so it's as polished as the rest of the room - I could still see brick.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but our room was small”
Reviews.Author: reeeviews0078
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute so we weren't really surprised at the price we paid. We checked in late but still recieved a warm welcome, although I found the reception area a bit small... Check in process didn't take very long and we were in our level 3 room in no time. The room was clean but a bit small and I found it a bit odd that the only window in the room was covered by a white plastic film. The bathroom was reasonable, a few dirty marks on the floor. Overall it was a nice stay, I found it quite nice that the receptionist allowed us to leave our bags in the reception for a few hours upon check out.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, savvy hotel”
Reviews.Author: belladirita
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! The hotel room I had was HUGE, corner room with loads of space and lots of great windows for me to look out. Blinds plus curtains for each window block out weather and noise - perfect! The staff were so friendly, efficient - 5 star service all the way. Also terrific location right near all the wonderful shops!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in central Sydney, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: RLM1981
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I found this place and liked it so much I ended up booking again. The staff were incredibly welcoming, always happy to help and even upgraded my room at no extra cost. It's a cool little place, no restaurant or bar but you're surrounded by places in central Sydney. A good find!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and extremely helpful staff at front desk,”
Reviews.Author: marrs_11
Reviews.Content: Great location, everything within walking distance, a very pleasurable stay, staff an asset to this hotel, nothing was too much effort for them. Thank you once again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: weatherdave
Reviews.Content: Not as good as I expected. Had a 2 bed suite. The problem is that this is an old hotel that has been renovated, but not completely renovated. Could be a bit cleaner, mold in the shower. Could be decorated a bit better, has lots of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT 5 Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjdv
Reviews.Content: Don't be lured by the 5 Star self-rating. Rooms are very small, poorly serviced and recent renovations look to have been done on a strict budget. (Very rough). Water from the shower floods the bathroom as there is no shower screen, only a shower curtain. YUK!! Reception staff are very friendly and rates are ok for a Sydney hotel in a good location, but don't expect a 5 star experience as you'll be in for more like a 3 and a half star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Comfortable Hotel in GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: AimeSandri
Reviews.Content: We spent the Melbourne Long Weekend in Sydney at the Park8 and had a GREAT weekend! Hugo and Larry at the front desk where both helpful and informative giving us details on local attractions and always provided assistance when asked. The hotel is located right near some of the most beautiful shops and within walking distance of 3 train stations making it a great, central location for exploring Sydney. The interior of the hotel was beautifully decorated with a trendy/natural look to the room. The bathroom was spacious and the beds where extremely comfortable. Pay TV in the room kept us entertained when we werenâ€™t looking out the window at the view of the city and Hyde Park. Great Stay - Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: water_lili_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room which was very small and quite dark. The lobby is also tiny. Everything was quite new though. On some booking sites the hotel self-rates as 5 stars - it is clearly not a 5 star hotel. On other booking websites, the rating is 4 stars, and that's probably more on the mark. The staff are very friendly. The location is good if you want to go shopping, (there are plenty of shops including the new Westfield nearby). It is quite central but for touristy areas such as Darling Harbour and the Sydney Opera House, there are hotels in better locations, as it is still a bit of a walk from Park8. The cost of internet is exorbitant. There are Starbucks, Gloria Jeans and McDonalds nearby, but the internet at Gloria Jeans and McDonalds were quite slow and unreliable. On the hotel's Guidebook, it lists a few places which offer rental cars. However, the location it lists for Avis is in Kings Cross (which is not the closest). The closest Avis Car Rental is in World Square on Pitt St, which is an 8 minute walk away. Overall, it is a good place to stay for one or two nights if you are not expecting much.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the heart of Syndey”
Reviews.Author: woolycow
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. It was 10 min walk from Darling Harbour and 20 mins to Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The reception staff were brilliant offering suggestions for places to eat, what were must sees based on our limited time and even offered a great tip on taking the ferry to Manly beach which covered the same ground as the cruises but for a fraction of the price plus we got to go to Manly ;)

Reviews.Title: “Money-grabbing operation”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Pierre D
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives. It is in a very good location and the rooms are clean. We had a 2-bedroom unit on the top floor. While it is 2 bedrooms, be aware that you will not have much privacy. The ground floor consists of a small kitchenette and living room. When you walk up the stairs you arrive directly in the first bedroom. You need to walk through it to get to the second bedroom. In addition the only bathroom is accessed rom the first bedroom. So people sleeping in the second bedroom need to go into the first bedroom to go to toilet.... Lighting in the bedrooms are bathroom is very poor. Can hardly see in your luggage when fetching something. It did not help that one light in the first bedroom and the ceiling light in the bathroom were not working. We asked the front desk to change the bulbs but nothing was done. The bathroom was not too well stocked in toiletries. One smal bottle of shampoo and one small bottle of bath gel for 4 people. There is no place to hang the towels in the bathrooms (although it is quite spacious) so they put the towels on the bed. So do not do like me and realize in the middle of the shower that the towel is on the bed of the second bedroom! Now, the worst thing is the internet ripoff. They have wireless but it is $10 per hour or $20 per day. Not cheap at all. This is how much I pay for a month of internet at my apartment. But this is not so rare for high-end hotels. However it does not stop here. At this price you can only use one computer. There were 4 of us with 2 computers and one iPad so they asked us to pay 3 times!!! $30 per hour for wireless!!! Come to think of it, maybe it was for a block of 2 hours. I have never seen this kind of price anywhere in the world. Every other place we stayed at on this trip we had free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: HolidayhoundLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park8 for 1 night in mid-January. We booked an early bird offer when the hotel first opened so the room was pretty good value. Having had a great stay at one of the other Eight Hotels in Sydney (the Diamant) a couple of weeks before I expected more from Park8, but I think the Diamant was so nice that we expected too much (albeit the Diamant was actually cheaper than Park8). Park8 was fine for a short stay, the room was a decent size and the bathroom was nicely done, with a great shower. The downside was that our room didnâ€™t have a proper window, just a frosted window which wasnâ€™t ideal! The hotel is new (opened November 2010) and I had expected everything to be newly fitted but it is clear that the hotel has just been a refurbishment of an older building (possibly an older hotel). Simple things like old doors and handles and dodgy paint jobs were noticeable and old cupboards in the room. Otherwise the new furniture and ipod dock in the room were nice features. However, on the positive side the staff were so friendly and helpful and very accommodating. The hotel is in a great location, close to George Street and walking distance to Circular Quay and the Rocks. There is no breakfast available but a multitude of local places serving all kinds of breakfast options are close by. I would recommend Park8 for a cheap stay close to the city centre, but you might want to request a room with a proper window as that was really the main reason for not rating this hotel higher.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel bed I have ever slept in - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: happyinoz
Reviews.Content: When you search for accommodation on wotif near to Darling Harbour this one does not appear, yet it is closer to Cockle Bay than others I have stayed in that are deemed to be around the bay. I would definately recommend this hotel. We stayed in a delux room and it was nice. I never wake without a bad back when staying in a hotel but this time I did. The beds and linen are wonderful. Absolutely terrific! The AC was noisy but I turned it down from the 2nd setting to the first fan speed and this helped. The hotel staff are attentive, efficient, pleasant and informative. Negative aspects and these are not significant and should not put you off staying here. *The hallways are very dark and not good if you are claustaphobic, better globes would change the feel but may not give the ambience the hotel desire. *The hotel is clearly newly renovated, our bathroom was great, the shower amazing but the grout on the lowest tile not sparklling white, also no towel rail or hooks. I would rate the hotel 4.5 rather than 5 star but close to it. I do believe we will stay here again on more that one occasion when we treat ourself to a night out in Sydney. Thank you Park8, carry on the excellent work.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again and again and would recommend to friends..”
Reviews.Author: Aybilu
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating management group.... Very hospitable and staying is too close to call home.. Stay during christmas times and been surprise with gifts that touches my family with simple thoughts.... Would definitely book again in this place when visiting Sydney and would recommend to all friends.. Highly commendable.. Keep up the good work...

Reviews.Title: “Cute new look”
Reviews.Author: FelineBred
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbed with a park theme. Love the theme! Stump-like stools, green carpet and polished concrete for the rooms and halls... very cute. New bathroom with rainshower shower head, quite nice but I did have a leaky sink. Really, really helpful and lovely woman on front desk. Rooms were small but adequate. There was also a pass to a local gym.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel while newly refurbished”
Reviews.Author: ochlophobic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. The front door leads to a small lobby which was still being completed. The room had new carpet and furnishings but I'm glad I hadn't used the same bathroom renovators for my own home! There was a persistent mildewy smell in the room, otherwise the bed was comfortable and the room quiet considering the location in the city. The hotel was reasonable value at opening specials and convenient for the meeting I attended, however the location near Town Hall railway station isn't exactly the most desirable part of Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: Park8 Hotel Sydney - by 8Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: 185 Castlereagh Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
